cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north and sliding parallel to the Florida east coast before aiming toward the Georgia-South Carolina coast and an eventual encounter with North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL; Hurricane Watch north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL; Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast (mainly north of West Palm Beach), Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts possible Tuesday, sustained winds largely below warning criteria (≤39 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1–2 ft possible along Biscayne Bay beaches; significant inundation not expected at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional squalls with 1–2 inches of total rainfall; localized higher amounts possible but widespread 4-inch totals unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents affecting pilot operations and small-craft movements in and out of the harbor.
